entry.title: Trump abruptly ends briefing after confrontation with reporter

media:group.media:title: Trump abruptly ends briefing after confrontation with reporter
media:group.media:description:
President Trump told CBS reporter Weijia Jiang to "ask China" in response to her question at a White House press conference and refused to answer questions from CNN's Kaitlan Collins.
#Trump #CNN #News

entry.title: New WH memo directs staffers entering West Wing to wear masks

media:group.media:title: New WH memo directs staffers entering West Wing to wear masks
media:group.media:description:
A memo went out to White House staffers today saying it is now required for all staffers entering West Wing to wear a face covering, a source familiar tells CNN. It also said that face coverings would be available in the medical office. Additionally, the memo told staffers to follow social distancing guidelines and placed restrictions on guests. CNN's Kaitlin Collins reports.
#Coronavirus #CNN #News

entry.title: Video shows participants removing masks ahead of Pence event

media:group.media:title: Video shows participants removing masks ahead of Pence event
media:group.media:description:
Participants at a food supply roundtable convened by Vice President Mike Pence in Iowa on May 8 removed their face masks before Pence arrived, according to video from the event posted online. The session at the West Des Moines headquarters of Hy-Vee grocery stores came hours after Pence's press secretary tested positive for coronavirus, delaying his flight to Iowa and prompting a scramble inside the White House to identify people who also could have been exposed. In the video, which was streamed by the Des Moines Register and first posted by The Intercept, executives from Mountaire Farms, Smithfield, Kroger and Tyson Foods remove their face coverings after an unidentified person emerged from backstage and motioned removing a mask. None of the companies represented immediately responded to a CNN request for comment. A White House official told CNN the vice president's advance staff "takes precautions to keep round table participants distanced at at least six feet -- meaning you don't need to wear a mask based on CDC guidance -- so to allow for them to not wear masks and have a more engaging dialogue." "Participants, who have their temp taken and are screened by physicians, are always more than welcome to do whatever they'd like," the official said.
#coronavirus #CNN #News

entry.title: Trump's favorite news channel you've never heard of

media:group.media:title: Trump's favorite news channel you've never heard of
media:group.media:description:
CNN's Brian Stelter introduces a little-known network that pushes far-right commentary and the occasional conspiracy theory. That network is One America News, a favorite of President Trump.
#Stelter #CNN #News

entry.title: Author reveals her steamy romance novel was inspired by Dr. Fauci

media:group.media:description: Author Sally Quinn tells CNN's Alisyn Camerota that Dr. Anthony Fauci inspired the lead character in her 1991 romance novel "Happy Endings." #CNN #News #usnews #happeningnow #newdaywithalisyncamerotaandchriscuomo

media:group.media:title: Shanghai Disneyland reopens with social distancing measures in place
media:group.media:description: Shanghai Disneyland has reopened with new social distancing measures in place despite new cases of coronavirus emerging across the country. CNN's David Culver reports. #CNN #News #cnni #worldnews

entry.title: Jake Tapper to Trump adviser: Here's what governors are telling me

media:group.media:title: Jake Tapper to Trump adviser: Here's what governors are telling me
media:group.media:description:
CNN's Jake Tapper tells White House adviser Kevin Hassett that governors want President Donald Trump to invoke the Defense Production Act so states can have access to critical supplies to fight the coronavirus pandemic.
#CNN #News

entry.title: Trump meets with military leaders. No one wears a mask

media:group.media:title: Trump meets with military leaders. No one wears a mask
media:group.media:description: Lawrence Summers, who served in the Obama and Clinton administrations, reacts to photos showing President Donald Trump's meeting with military leaders the day it was announced that the CDC director, FDA commissioner and Dr. Anthony Fauci would take various measures to quarantine after being exposed to a person at the White House who tested positive for Covid-19. #CNN #News

entry.title: San Francisco sued over 'nightmare' neighborhood conditions

media:group.media:title: San Francisco sued over 'nightmare' neighborhood conditions
media:group.media:description: In SF's Tenderloin district, after the number of tents jumped nearly 300%, residents, businesses and a nearby law school are suing to force the city to clean it up. #CNN #News

entry.title: Smerconish lays out Covid-19's deadly toll on the US economy

media:group.media:title: Smerconish lays out Covid-19's deadly toll on the US economy
media:group.media:description:
CNN's Michael Smerconish looks into how the unemployment crisis, economic downturns and the stress of isolation with no clear end date could significantly increase "deaths of despair."
#CNN #News
